Detailed Description

This interface is an event listener used to receive sensor data asynchronously.

The SensorEventListener interface is an event listener used to receive sensor data asynchronously.

It provides methods that are invoked when the sensor data is received from the device.

The following example demonstrates how to use the SensorEventListener 

 class MyPage : public Page, public SensorEventListener {
  public:
      MyPage();
      ~MyPage();
      virtual void onInit(Persistence* const savedInstanceState);
      virtual void onPause();
      virtual void onDataReceived(const SensorData& data);
  private:
      SensorManager* mSM;
 }

 MyPage::onInit(Persistence* const savedInstanceState) {
  //new SensorManager instance
  mSM = new SensorManager(Context);
  //add Sensor listener
  if(mSM->IsAvailable(SensorManager::SENSORS_TYPE_ACCELERATION)) {
      mSM->AddSensorListener(*this, SensorManager::SENSORS_TYPE_ACCELERATION, SensorManager::SENSOR_DELAY_NORMAL, true);
  }
 }

 void MyPage::onDataReceived(const SensorData& data){
  //Add your implement
  //Override onDataReceived() for just receiving the sensor data.
 }

 MyPage::onPause(){
  //remove Sensor listener
  mSM->RemoveSensorListener(*this);
 }
